 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לֹט‎</span> **noun [masculine]** ==myrrh==, or ***'ladanum'*** (Greek), an aromatic gum exuded by leaves of ***cistus-rose, cistus villosus***, [[BDB#Tristr|Tristr]]<sup>FFP, 235, and especially Nat. Hist. Bib., 458 ff.</sup>; [[BDB#Ri|Ri]]<sup>HWB 897</sup>, compare [[BDB#Löw|Löw]]<sup>No. 79</sup> [[BDB#Di|Di]]<sup>[[Gen.37.25|Gen 37:25]]</sup> [[BDB#Now|Now]]<sup>Archaeology i. 64</sup> (Sabean <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לדן‎</span>, [[BDB#SabDenkm|SabDenkm]]<sup>84</sup>; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***ladunu***</u></abbr> (from Damascus) compare [[BDB#Schr|Schr]]<sup>COT</sup> [[Gen.37.25|Gen 37:25]], MBAk. 1881, pp. 413 ff.; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, whence Greek <span class="bdbLangGreek">λήδανον</span>, <span class="bdbLangGreek">λάδανον</span> Hdt<sup>iii. 112</sup>); — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּצְרִי וָלֹט נְכאֹת‎</span> [[Gen.37.25|Gen 37:25]], merchandise of Ishmaelite caravan, compare [[Gen.43.11|Gen 43:11]], present to Joseph (both [[BDB#J|J]]; [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] <span class="bdbLangGreek">στακτή</span>).
